It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and Angola. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright shrub form and its compound leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in spherical inflorescences, and it produces small, hard pods that contain seeds. Acacia bequaertii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it an important component of its native ecosystems.
